newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippines' Subic to tap World Bank, OECF loans.
newsitem.headline: Philippines' Subic to tap World Bank, OECF loans.

text.p: The Subic Bay Metropolitan Authority said on Thursday it would borrow $60 million from the World Bank and $9 million from the Overseas Economic Cooperation Fund to improve the infrastructures inside the freeport.
Subic is improving several vital facilities inside the freeport which hosts more than $2 billion worth in investments.
Subic used to be the Asian home of the United States navy until it was converted in 1992 as the Philippines' first freeport zone.
